alert.note: Alert for Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 5:30AM EST until January 11 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey, including the following counties, Sussex and Warren. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 526 AM EST, flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain occurred Tuesday and Tuesday night. - For Paulins Kill at Blairstown: At 5:15am the stage was 5.21 feet. Flood Stage is 5 feet. ... For Pequest River at Huntsville: At 5:15am the stage was 4.57 feet. Flood Stage is 4 feet. ... For Delaware River at Tocks Island: At 5:15am the stage was 13.72 feet. Flood Stage is 21 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
